    <div id="guide_header_title">
     <h1>
      <span class="guidetitle">
       Inequality and U.S. Public Policy &nbsp;
      </span>
     </h1>
    </div>
    <div class="guideattr" id="guideattr">
     <span id="lastupdate" class="lastupdate">
      Last Updated: Aug 17, 2016
     </span>
     <span class="guideurl">
      URL: http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/inequality

    <div id="content">
     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:758px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox21736751">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21736751">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21736751">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Selecting a law
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21736751">
          <p>
           The following websites may help you browse as you consider selecting a public law.
          </p>
          <p>
           You may also consider searching the web or newspapers/news databases for "public law" or "federal legislation" plus words describing a theme or topic area (e.g., "federal legislation" and environment) may help you explore laws in a specific area of interest).
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt21736751" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
             <li id="link25221649">
              <a id="link_25221649" href="http://thomas.loc.gov/home/LegislativeData.php?&amp;n=PublicLaws&amp;c=114" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25221649,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Inequality and U.S. Public Policy', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 25221649}); ">
               Browse Public Laws (THOMAS)
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               First, select a session of Congress. Then select a range of public laws. Browse the lists to explore possible laws.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25221601">
              <a id="link_25221601" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_United_States_federal_legislation,_2001%E2%80%93present" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25221601,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Inequality and U.S. Public Policy', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 25221601}); ">
               List of United States federal legislation, 2001â€“present (Wikipedia)
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Please note that this is a selected list.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25221672">
              <a id="link_25221672" href="http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/browse/collection.action?collectionCode=PLAW" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25221672,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Inequality and U.S. Public Policy', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 25221672}); ">
               Public and Private Laws (Government Publishing Office)
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox17116472">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17116472">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17116472">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Major resources for your legislative genealogy
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17116472">
          <p>
           The following resources will help you find the full text of the
           <em>
            <strong>
             final public law, versions of the bill in progress, sponsors/co-sponsors, votes, summaries of the bills/law, and selected information on support/opposition through hearings and debates
            </strong>
           </em>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Congress.gov
           </strong>
           <br />
           <a href="https://www.congress.gov/">
            https://www.congress.gov/
            <br />
           </a>
           Use the "Search by number" link, then select the checkbox for the session of Congress in which your law was passed, then enter your law's citation number in the search box without spaces (e.g., 111PL148).
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            ProQuest Congressional
           </strong>
           <br />
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/congressional">
            http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/congressional
           </a>
           <br />
           Use the "Search for legislative histories" link, then search on the
           <em>
            exact
           </em>
           title of your selected law. Use Google first to determine the exact title, session of Congress, and number of your selected law if you don't already know it.
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17116472" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox20282961">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="20282961">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title20282961">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Find more on context, support/opposition to the bill
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content20282961">
          <p>
           <strong>
            WITH NEWS ARTICLES
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           You may also find searching newspaper articles on the bill useful to connect to current events reporting and public opinion.&nbsp; The following library databases include good selections of newspaper articles.&nbsp; These news articles may help you understand support/opposition from/within a variety of groups, such as: Congress, the President, the public, advocacy/lobbying groups, and more.&nbsp;
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=aph">
             Academic Search Complete
            </a>
            <br />
            A database of both scholarly and popular publications in a wide variety of disciplines and subject areas, including political science. Most full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise use the
            <strong>
             Check for Full Text
            </strong>
            <span>
             &nbsp;buttons
            </span>
            &nbsp;to check for full text online or in the library.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.lexisnexis.com/hottopics/lnacademic">
             LexisNexis Academic
            </a>
            <br />
            A database of popular newspapers, magazines, and broadcast transcripts, as well as business publications, legal materials, and more. Full text is linked directly in the database.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            WITH PUBLIC OPINION DATA
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Gallup
           <br />
           <a href="http://www.gallup.com/home.aspx">
            http://www.gallup.com/home.aspx
           </a>
           <br />
           <em>
            Presents daily briefings on a single current topic, as well as recent Gallup Poll findings.
           </em>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Polling Report
           <br />
           <a href="http://www.pollingreport.com/">
            http://www.pollingreport.com/
            <br />
           </a>
           <em>
            Biweekly overview of recent poll trends.
           </em>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Public Opinion Quarterly -- "The Polls"
           <br />
           Location:
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/direct.asp?db=ufh&amp;jid=POQ&amp;scope=site">
            Online
           </a>
           <br />
           <em>
            Regular feature of preeminent scholarly journal on public opinion and polling, discusses recent surveys.&nbsp; Browse through each issue to access "The Polls" or search across the journal by topic to check for features on your topic.
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            WITH LOBBYING AND CAMPAIGN FINANCE INFORMATION
           </strong>
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            <a href="http://www.fec.gov/">
             Federal Election Commission
            </a>
            <ul>
             <li>
              <a href="http://www.fec.gov/finance/disclosure/candcmte_info.shtml">
               ***Campaign Finance Reports and Data***
              </a>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a href="http://www.opensecrets.org/influence/index.php">
             Influence and Lobbying
            </a>
            (OpenSecrets.org)
            <ul>
             <li>
              <a href="http://www.opensecrets.org/lobby/search.php">
               ***Lobbying Advanced Search***
              </a>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a href="http://pml.cq.com/">
             Political MoneyLine
            </a>
            (CQ Roll Call)
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           <strong>
            &nbsp;
           </strong>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt20282961" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox20283074">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="20283074">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title20283074">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding information on campaign finance
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content20283074">
          <p>
           <a href="http://www.fec.gov/">
            Federal Election Commission
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <a href="http://www.fec.gov/finance/disclosure/candcmte_info.shtml">
            ***Campaign Finance Reports and Data***
           </a>
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="http://www.opensecrets.org/">
            Open Secrets
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <a href="http://www.opensecrets.org/influence/index.php">
            Influence and Lobbying
           </a>
           <br />
           <a href="http://www.opensecrets.org/lobby/search.php">
            ***Lobbying Advanced Search***
           </a>
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="http://pml.cq.com/">
            Political MoneyLine
           </a>
           (CQ Roll Call)
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt20283074" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18466535">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18466535">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18466535">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Citing your sources
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content18460062">
          <ul>
           <li>
            For information on
            <strong>
             why to cite your sources
            </strong>
            and
            <strong>
             how to avoid plagiarism
            </strong>
            , see the
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3856388">
             Get Started with Library Research: Cite Sources
            </a>
            guide.
            <br />
            <br />
           </li>
           <li>
            For help using
            <strong>
             Chicago style
            </strong>
            , consult the following resources::
           </li>
          </ul>
          <blockquote>
           <ul>
            <li>
             <em>
              The Chicago manual of style
             </em>
             (16th ed., 2010)
             <br />
             Location:
             <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=Http://www.chicagomanualofstyle.org/16/contents.html">
              Online
             </a>
             or search Encompass Search by title or Ready Reference 808.027 C632m
            </li>
           </ul>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Chicago Manual of Style (Purdue Online Writing Lab)
             <br />
             <a href="http://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/resource/717/01/">
              http://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/resource/717/01/
             </a>
            </li>
           </ul>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Chicago Style (Trexler Library, Muhlenberg College)
             <br />
             <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/media/content,assets/library/docs/chicago_example.pdf">
              http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/media/content,assets/library/docs/chicago_example.pdf
             </a>
            </li>
           </ul>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Chicago/Turabian Documentation Style (Writing Center, University of Wisconsin--Madison)
             <br />
             <a href="http://www.wisc.edu/writing/Handbook/DocChicago.html" target="_blank">
              http://www.wisc.edu/writing/Handbook/DocChicago.html
             </a>
            </li>
           </ul>
          </blockquote>
          <ul>
           <li>
            <a href="http://www.zotero.org/">
             Zotero
            </a>
            <br />
            "Free, easy-to-use tool to help you collect, organize, cite, and share your research sources." Download instructions and help available on the site.
           </li>
          </ul>
          <div id="boxatt18460062" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
      <div id="profile4652120" class="profile_wrapper">
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18466445">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18466445">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18466445">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Need Help with Your Research?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17117745">
          <p>
           <em>
            Contact:
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <b>
            Jen Jarson
           </b>
           <br />
           Social Sciences Reference Librarian
           <br />
           phone: 484-664-3552
           <br />
           email: jarson@muhlenberg.edu
           <br />
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17117745" class="boxatt">
